column4: is it possible to compress everything the way u can on an ntfs partition in windows xp?
make a big tar.bz2 file
you could fit one ISO file. I suggest using AcidRip and encoding to XviD or x264 to save some space.
i want the dvd to be exactly like my original xept compressed to a 4.7 gb dvd
dd if=/dev/dvd of=/path/to/file.iso
i dint understand that
now you have a full-size ISO file. Now run bzip2 on it and it will get a bit smaller.
do u no of any windows freeware that i can use thru wine that would compress directly bcuz i have no internet on that comp and windows apps dont ask for dependencies
DVD video and audio is already compressed, somewhat, using MPEG2. Compressing more, especially with a general purpose lossless algorithm like gzip or bzip2, will likely not work.
both dd and bzip2 are included in a base system.
you may have to read the dd man file for some info.
no offense but u rely lose me with the way u talk
ok, sorry. Did I skip something? Where'd I lose you?
like "special words" like dd and bzip2 etc
are you familiar with the command line?
well somewat i guess
like i dont avoid it
ok, dd is a bitstream copyer thingy that you can use to make ISO images of CDs and DVDs, among many many other things.
so, sudo dd if=/dev/dvd of=/path/to/file.iso will create a copy of the input file (if) to the output file (of).
wat does that command do? compress?
there are dozens of compression utilities for Linux.
